segment.source: How to Move MBAM 2.0 Features to Another Computer
segment.target: How to Move MBAM 2.0 Features to Another Computer

segment.source: How to Move MBAM 2.0 Features to Another Computer
segment.target: How to Move MBAM 2.0 Features to Another Computer

segment.source: How to Move MBAM 2.0 Features to Another Computer
segment.target: How to Move MBAM 2.0 Features to Another Computer

segment.source: This topic describes the steps that you should take to move one or more Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) features to a different computer.
segment.target: This topic describes the steps that you should take to move one or more Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) features to a different computer.

segment.source: When moving more than one Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring feature, you should move them in the following order:
segment.target: When moving more than one Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring feature, you should move them in the following order:

segment.source: Recovery Database
segment.target: Recovery Database

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Reports
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Reports

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring

segment.source: Moving the Recovery Database
segment.target: Moving the Recovery Database

segment.source: To move the Recovery Database from one computer to another (for example, from Server A to Server B), use the following procedure.
segment.target: To move the Recovery Database from one computer to another (for example, from Server A to Server B), use the following procedure.

segment.source: Stop all instances of the Administration and Monitoring web site.
segment.target: Stop all instances of the Administration and Monitoring web site.

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B.
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B.

segment.source: Back up the MBAM Recovery Database on Server A.
segment.target: Back up the MBAM Recovery Database on Server A.

segment.source: Move the MBAM Recovery Database from Server A to B.
segment.target: Move the MBAM Recovery Database from Server A to B.

segment.source: Restore the MBAM Recovery Database on Server B.
segment.target: Restore the MBAM Recovery Database on Server B.

segment.source: Configure access to the MBAM Recovery Database on Server B.
segment.target: Configure access to the MBAM Recovery Database on Server B.

segment.source: Update the database connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers.
segment.target: Update the database connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers.

segment.source: Resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: Resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: Stop All Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Stop All Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: On each of the servers running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the MBAM website, which is named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On each of the servers running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the MBAM website, which is named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter command line that is similar to the:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter command line that is similar to the:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To run this PowerShell command line, the IIS Module for PowerShell must be added to current instance of PowerShell.
segment.target: To run this PowerShell command line, the IIS Module for PowerShell must be added to current instance of PowerShell.

segment.source: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable execution of scripts.
segment.target: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable execution of scripts.

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B and select only the Recovery Database for installation.
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B and select only the Recovery Database for installation.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the name of the server and instance to which the Recovery Database will be moved.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the name of the server and instance to which the Recovery Database will be moved.

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$ - Enter the domain and server names of each MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server that will contact the Recovery Database.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$ - Enter the domain and server names of each MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server that will contact the Recovery Database.

segment.source: Use a semi-colon to separate each domain and server pairs in the list (for example, $DOMAINSERVERNAME$;$DOMAIN$SERVERNAME$$).
segment.target: Use a semi-colon to separate each domain and server pairs in the list (for example, $DOMAINSERVERNAME$;$DOMAIN$SERVERNAME$$).

segment.source: Each server name must be followed by a “$” symbol, as shown in the example (MyDomainMyServerName1$; MyDomainMyServerName2$).
segment.target: Each server name must be followed by a “$” symbol, as shown in the example (MyDomainMyServerName1$; MyDomainMyServerName2$).

segment.source: $X$ - Enter 0 if you are installing the MBAM Stand-alone topology, or 1 if you are installing the MBAM Configuration Manager topology.
segment.target: $X$ - Enter 0 if you are installing the MBAM Stand-alone topology, or 1 if you are installing the MBAM Configuration Manager topology.

segment.source: Back Up the Recovery Database on Server A
segment.target: Back Up the Recovery Database on Server A

segment.source: To back up the Recovery Database on Server A, use SQL Server Management Studio and the Task named Back Up.
segment.target: To back up the Recovery Database on Server A, use SQL Server Management Studio and the Task named Back Up.

segment.source: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery Database.
segment.target: By default, the database name is MBAM Recovery Database.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, create a SQL file (.sql) that contains the following SQL script:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, create a SQL file (.sql) that contains the following SQL script:

segment.source: Modify the MBAM Recovery Database to use the full recovery mode.
segment.target: Modify the MBAM Recovery Database to use the full recovery mode.

segment.target: -- Create MBAM Recovery Database Data and MBAM Recovery logical backup devices.

segment.target: $PASSWORD$ - Enter a password that you will use to encrypt the Private Key file.

segment.source: Move the Recovery Database and Certificate from Server A to Server B
segment.target: Move the Recovery Database and Certificate from Server A to Server B

segment.source: Move the following file from Server A to Server B by using Windows Explorer.
segment.target: Move the following file from Server A to Server B by using Windows Explorer.

segment.source: MBAM Recovery Database data.bak
segment.target: MBAM Recovery Database data.bak

segment.source: To move the certificate for the encrypted database, use the following automation steps.
segment.target: To move the certificate for the encrypted database, use the following automation steps.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following value in the example above with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following value in the example above with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$ - Enter the name of the server to which the files will be copied.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$ - Enter the name of the server to which the files will be copied.

segment.source: $DESTINATIONSHARE$ - Enter the name of the share and path to which the files will be copied.
segment.target: $DESTINATIONSHARE$ - Enter the name of the share and path to which the files will be copied.

segment.source: Restore the Recovery Database on Server B
segment.target: Restore the Recovery Database on Server B

segment.source: Restore the Recovery Database on Server B by using SQL Server Management Studio and the task named Restore Database.
segment.target: Restore the Recovery Database on Server B by using SQL Server Management Studio and the task named Restore Database.

segment.source: Once the task has been completed, select the database backup file by selecting the From Device option and then use the Add command to select the MBAM Recovery database Data.bak file.
segment.target: Once the task has been completed, select the database backup file by selecting the From Device option and then use the Add command to select the MBAM Recovery database Data.bak file.

segment.source: Select OK to complete the restoration process.
segment.target: Select OK to complete the restoration process.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, create a SQL file (.sql) that contains the following-SQL script:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, create a SQL file (.sql) that contains the following-SQL script:

segment.target: -- Drop certificate created by MBAM Setup.

segment.source: Configure Access to the Recovery Database on Server B
segment.target: Configure Access to the Recovery Database on Server B

segment.source: On Server B, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the computer accounts from each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature to the Local Group named MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access.
segment.target: On Server B, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the computer accounts from each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature to the Local Group named MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access.

segment.source: Verify that the SQL login MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access on the restored database is mapped to the login name $MachineName$MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access.
segment.target: Verify that the SQL login MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access on the restored database is mapped to the login name $MachineName$MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access.

segment.source: If it is not mapped as described, create another login with similar group memberships, and map it to the login name $MachineName$MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access.
segment.target: If it is not mapped as described, create another login with similar group memberships, and map it to the login name $MachineName$MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell on Server B to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell on Server B to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following values in the example above with the applicable values for your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following values in the example above with the applicable values for your environment:

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$$ - Enter the domain and machine name of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$$ - Enter the domain and machine name of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: The server name must be followed by a $, as shown in the example (for example, MyDomainMyServerName1$).
segment.target: The server name must be followed by a $, as shown in the example (for example, MyDomainMyServerName1$).

segment.source: This command line must be run for each Administration and Monitoring Server that will be accessing the database in your environment.
segment.target: This command line must be run for each Administration and Monitoring Server that will be accessing the database in your environment.

segment.source: Update the Recovery Database Connection Data on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers
segment.target: Update the Recovery Database Connection Data on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers

segment.source: On each of the servers running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Connection String information for the following applications, which are hosted in the Administration and Monitoring website:
segment.target: On each of the servers running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Connection String information for the following applications, which are hosted in the Administration and Monitoring website:

segment.source: MBAMAdministrationService
segment.target: MBAMAdministrationService

segment.source: MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService
segment.target: MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService

segment.source: Select each application and use the Configuration Editor feature, which is located under the Management section of the Feature View.
segment.target: Select each application and use the Configuration Editor feature, which is located under the Management section of the Feature View.

segment.source: Select the configurationStrings option from the Section list control.
segment.target: Select the configurationStrings option from the Section list control.

segment.source: Select the row named (Collection) and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.
segment.target: Select the row named (Collection) and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.

segment.source: In the Collection Editor, select the row named KeyRecoveryConnectionString when updating the configuration for the MBAMAdministrationService application or the row named Microsoft.Mbam.RecoveryAndHardwareDataStore.ConnectionString when updating the configuration for the MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService.
segment.target: In the Collection Editor, select the row named KeyRecoveryConnectionString when updating the configuration for the MBAMAdministrationService application or the row named Microsoft.Mbam.RecoveryAndHardwareDataStore.ConnectionString when updating the configuration for the MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService.

segment.source: Update the Data Source= value for the configurationStrings property to list the server name and instance (for example, $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$) where the Recovery Database was moved to.
segment.target: Update the Data Source= value for the configurationStrings property to list the server name and instance (for example, $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$) where the Recovery Database was moved to.

segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows to enter a command line, that is similar to the following, on each Administration and Monitoring Server:

segment.target: Note

segment.target: Replace the following value in the example above with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Recovery Database is.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Recovery Database is.

segment.source: Resume all Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Resume all Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to start the MBAM website, which is named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to start the MBAM website, which is named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: Moving the Compliance and Audit Database Feature
segment.target: Moving the Compliance and Audit Database Feature

segment.source: If you want to move the MBAM Compliance and Audit Database from one computer to another (that is, move the database from Server A to Server B), use the following procedure.
segment.target: If you want to move the MBAM Compliance and Audit Database from one computer to another (that is, move the database from Server A to Server B), use the following procedure.

segment.source: The process includes the following high-level steps:
segment.target: The process includes the following high-level steps:

segment.source: Stop all instances of the Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: Stop all instances of the Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: Run MBAM setup on Server B.
segment.target: Run MBAM setup on Server B.

segment.source: Back up the Database on Server A.
segment.target: Back up the Database on Server A.

segment.source: Move the Database from Server A to B.
segment.target: Move the Database from Server A to B.

segment.source: Restore the Database on Server B.
segment.target: Restore the Database on Server B.

segment.source: Configure access to the Database on Server B.
segment.target: Configure access to the Database on Server B.

segment.source: Update the database connection data on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers.
segment.target: Update the database connection data on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers.

segment.source: Update the SSRS reports data source connection string with the new location of the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Update the SSRS reports data source connection string with the new location of the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Resume all instances of the Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: Resume all instances of the Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: Stop All Instances of the Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Stop All Instances of the Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To run this command line, you must add the IIS Module for PowerShell to the current instance of PowerShell.
segment.target: To run this command line, you must add the IIS Module for PowerShell to the current instance of PowerShell.

segment.source: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable scripts to be run.
segment.target: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable scripts to be run.

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B and select only the Compliance and Audit Database for installation.
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B and select only the Compliance and Audit Database for installation.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Note: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Note: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Compliance and Audit Database will be moved to.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Compliance and Audit Database will be moved to.

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$ - Enter the domain and server names of each MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server that will contact the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$ - Enter the domain and server names of each MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server that will contact the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: Use a semi-colon to separate each domain and server pair in the list (for example, $DOMAINSERVERNAME$;$DOMAIN$SERVERNAME$$).
segment.target: Use a semi-colon to separate each domain and server pair in the list (for example, $DOMAINSERVERNAME$;$DOMAIN$SERVERNAME$$).

segment.source: Each server name must be followed by a “$” symbol, as shown in the example (MyDomainMyServerName1$; MyDomainMyServerName2$).
segment.target: Each server name must be followed by a “$” symbol, as shown in the example (MyDomainMyServerName1$; MyDomainMyServerName2$).

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit Reports feature to connect to the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit Reports feature to connect to the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: $X$ - Enter 0 if you are installing the MBAM Stand-alone topology, or 1 if you are installing the MBAM Configuration Manager topology.
segment.target: $X$ - Enter 0 if you are installing the MBAM Stand-alone topology, or 1 if you are installing the MBAM Configuration Manager topology.

segment.target: Back Up the Compliance and Audit Database on Server A

segment.source: The command line for adding the servers to the MBAM Compliance and Audit Database access local group must be run for each Administration and Monitoring Server that will be accessing the database in your environment.
segment.target: The command line for adding the servers to the MBAM Compliance and Audit Database access local group must be run for each Administration and Monitoring Server that will be accessing the database in your environment.

segment.source: Update the Database Connection Data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers
segment.target: Update the Database Connection Data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers

segment.source: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the connection string information for the following applications, which are hosted in the Administration and Monitoring website:
segment.target: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the connection string information for the following applications, which are hosted in the Administration and Monitoring website:

segment.source: MBAMAdministrationService
segment.target: MBAMAdministrationService

segment.source: MBAMComplianceStatusService
segment.target: MBAMComplianceStatusService

segment.source: Select each application and use the Configuration Editor feature, which is located under the Management section of the Feature View.
segment.target: Select each application and use the Configuration Editor feature, which is located under the Management section of the Feature View.

segment.source: Select the configurationStrings option from the Section list control.
segment.target: Select the configurationStrings option from the Section list control.

segment.source: Select the row named (Collection), and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.
segment.target: Select the row named (Collection), and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.

segment.source: In the Collection Editor, select the row named ComplianceStatusConnectionString when updating the configuration for the MBAMAdministrationService application, or the row named Microsoft.Windows.Mdop.BitLockerManagement.StatusReportDataStore.ConnectionString when updating the configuration for the MBAMComplianceStatusService.
segment.target: In the Collection Editor, select the row named ComplianceStatusConnectionString when updating the configuration for the MBAMAdministrationService application, or the row named Microsoft.Windows.Mdop.BitLockerManagement.StatusReportDataStore.ConnectionString when updating the configuration for the MBAMComplianceStatusService.

segment.source: Update the Data Source= value for the configurationStrings property to list the name of the server and instance (for example, $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME) to which the Recovery Database was moved.
segment.target: Update the Data Source= value for the configurationStrings property to list the name of the server and instance (for example, $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME) to which the Recovery Database was moved.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows to enter a command line on each Administration and Monitoring Server that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows to enter a command line on each Administration and Monitoring Server that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Recovery Database is located.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Recovery Database is located.

segment.source: Resume All Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Resume All Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to start the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to start the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Moving the Compliance and Audit Reports
segment.target: Moving the Compliance and Audit Reports

segment.source: If you want to move the MBAM Compliance and Audit Reports from one computer to another (that is, move the reports from Server A to Server B), use the following procedure, which includes the following high-level steps:
segment.target: If you want to move the MBAM Compliance and Audit Reports from one computer to another (that is, move the reports from Server A to Server B), use the following procedure, which includes the following high-level steps:

segment.source: Run MBAM setup on Server B.
segment.target: Run MBAM setup on Server B.

segment.source: Configure access to the Compliance and Audit Reports on Server B.
segment.target: Configure access to the Compliance and Audit Reports on Server B.

segment.source: Stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: Stop all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: Update the reports connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers.
segment.target: Update the reports connection data on MBAM Administration and Monitoring servers.

segment.source: Resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: Resume all instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B and select only the Compliance and Audit Reports feature for installation.
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B and select only the Compliance and Audit Reports feature for installation.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Compliance and Audit Database is located.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the server name and instance where the Compliance and Audit Database is located.

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit Reports feature to connect to the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit Reports feature to connect to the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: $PASSWORD$ - Enter the password of the user account that will be used to connect to the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: $PASSWORD$ - Enter the password of the user account that will be used to connect to the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: $X$ - Enter 0 if you are installing the MBAM Stand-alone topology, or 1 if you are installing the MBAM Configuration Manager topology.
segment.target: $X$ - Enter 0 if you are installing the MBAM Stand-alone topology, or 1 if you are installing the MBAM Configuration Manager topology.

segment.source: Configure Access to the Compliance and Audit Reports on Server B
segment.target: Configure Access to the Compliance and Audit Reports on Server B

segment.source: On Server B, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the user accounts that will have access to the Compliance and Audit Reports.
segment.target: On Server B, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the user accounts that will have access to the Compliance and Audit Reports.

segment.source: Add the user accounts to the local group named MBAM Report Users.
segment.target: Add the user accounts to the local group named MBAM Report Users.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line on Server B that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line on Server B that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following values in the example above with the applicable values for your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following values in the example above with the applicable values for your environment:

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$REPORTSUSERNAME$ - Enter the user account name that was used to configure the data source for the Compliance and Audit reports.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$REPORTSUSERNAME$ - Enter the user account name that was used to configure the data source for the Compliance and Audit reports.

segment.source: The command line for adding the users to the MBAM Report Users local group must be run for each user that will be accessing the reports in your environment.
segment.target: The command line for adding the users to the MBAM Report Users local group must be run for each user that will be accessing the reports in your environment.

segment.source: Stop All Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Stop All Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to stop the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Update the Database Connection Data on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers
segment.target: Update the Database Connection Data on the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Servers

segment.source: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Compliance and Audit Reports URL.
segment.target: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to update the Compliance and Audit Reports URL.

segment.source: Select the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring website, and use the Configuration Editor feature that is location under the Management section of the Feature View.
segment.target: Select the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring website, and use the Configuration Editor feature that is location under the Management section of the Feature View.

segment.source: Select the appSettings option from the Section list control.
segment.target: Select the appSettings option from the Section list control.

segment.source: Select the row named (Collection) and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.
segment.target: Select the row named (Collection) and open the Collection Editor by selecting the button on the right side of the row.

segment.source: In the Collection Editor, select the row named Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url.
segment.target: In the Collection Editor, select the row named Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url.

segment.source: Update the value for Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url to reflect the server name for Server B. If the Compliance and Audit Reports feature was installed on a named SQL Reporting Services instance, be sure to add or update the name of the instance to the URL (for example, http://$SERVERNAME$/ReportServer$SQLSRSINSTANCENAME$/Pages....)
segment.target: Update the value for Microsoft.Mbam.Reports.Url to reflect the server name for Server B. If the Compliance and Audit Reports feature was installed on a named SQL Reporting Services instance, be sure to add or update the name of the instance to the URL (for example, http://$SERVERNAME$/ReportServer$SQLSRSINSTANCENAME$/Pages....)

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line on each Administration and Monitoring Server that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line on each Administration and Monitoring Server that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$ - Enter the name of the server name to which the Compliance and Audit Reports were installed.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$ - Enter the name of the server name to which the Compliance and Audit Reports were installed.

segment.source: $SRSINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the name of the SQL Reporting Services instance to which the Compliance and Audit Reports were installed.
segment.target: $SRSINSTANCENAME$ - Enter the name of the SQL Reporting Services instance to which the Compliance and Audit Reports were installed.

segment.source: Resume All Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Resume All Instances of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to Start the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: On each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server feature, use the Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager console to Start the MBAM website named Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To run this command line, you must add the IIS Module for PowerShell to current instance of PowerShell.
segment.target: To run this command line, you must add the IIS Module for PowerShell to current instance of PowerShell.

segment.source: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable scripts to be run.
segment.target: In addition, you must update the PowerShell execution policy to enable scripts to be run.

segment.source: Moving the Administration and Monitoring Feature
segment.target: Moving the Administration and Monitoring Feature

segment.source: If you want to move the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Reports feature from one computer to another (that is, move the feature from Server A to Server B), use the following procedure, which includes the following high-level steps:
segment.target: If you want to move the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Reports feature from one computer to another (that is, move the feature from Server A to Server B), use the following procedure, which includes the following high-level steps:

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B.
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B.

segment.source: Configure access to the Database on Server B.
segment.target: Configure access to the Database on Server B.

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup on Server B and select only the Administration and Monitoring Server feature for installation.
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup on Server B and select only the Administration and Monitoring Server feature for installation.

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following values in the example above with those that match your environment:

segment.source: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - For the COMPLIDBSQLINSTANCE parameter, enter the server name and instance where the Compliance and Audit Database is located.
segment.target: $SERVERNAME$$SQLINSTANCENAME$ - For the COMPLIDBSQLINSTANCE parameter, enter the server name and instance where the Compliance and Audit Database is located.

segment.source: For the RECOVERYANDHWDBSQLINSTANCE parameter, enter the server name and instance where the Recovery Database is located.
segment.target: For the RECOVERYANDHWDBSQLINSTANCE parameter, enter the server name and instance where the Recovery Database is located.

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit Reports feature to connect to the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$USERNAME$ - Enter the domain and user name that will be used by the Compliance and Audit Reports feature to connect to the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: $ REPORTSSERVERURL$ - Enter the URL for the Home location of the SQL Reporting Service website.
segment.target: $ REPORTSSERVERURL$ - Enter the URL for the Home location of the SQL Reporting Service website.

segment.source: If the reports were installed to a default SRS instance, the URL format will have the format “http:// $SERVERNAME$/ReportServer”.
segment.target: If the reports were installed to a default SRS instance, the URL format will have the format “http:// $SERVERNAME$/ReportServer”.

segment.source: If the reports were installed to a default SRS instance, the URL format will have the format “http://$SERVERNAME$/ReportServer$SQLINSTANCENAME$”.
segment.target: If the reports were installed to a default SRS instance, the URL format will have the format “http://$SERVERNAME$/ReportServer$SQLINSTANCENAME$”.

segment.source: $X$ - Enter 0 if you are installing the MBAM Stand-alone topology, or 1 if you are installing the MBAM Configuration Manager topology.
segment.target: $X$ - Enter 0 if you are installing the MBAM Stand-alone topology, or 1 if you are installing the MBAM Configuration Manager topology.

segment.source: Configure Access to the Databases
segment.target: Configure Access to the Databases

segment.source: On the server or servers where the Recovery Database and Compliance and Audit Database are deployed, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the computer accounts from each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server feature to the local groups named MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access (Recovery DB Server) and MBAM Compliance Status DB Access (Compliance and Audit Database Server).
segment.target: On the server or servers where the Recovery Database and Compliance and Audit Database are deployed, use the Local user and Groups snap-in from Server Manager to add the computer accounts from each server that is running the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server feature to the local groups named MBAM Recovery and Hardware DB Access (Recovery DB Server) and MBAM Compliance Status DB Access (Compliance and Audit Database Server).

segment.source: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line, that is similar to the following, on the server where the Compliance and Audit Database was deployed.
segment.target: To automate this procedure, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line, that is similar to the following, on the server where the Compliance and Audit Database was deployed.

segment.source: On the server where the Recovery database was deployed, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:
segment.target: On the server where the Recovery database was deployed, you can use Windows PowerShell to enter a command line that is similar to the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace the following value in the example above with the applicable values for your environment:
segment.target: Replace the following value in the example above with the applicable values for your environment:

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$$ - Enter the domain and machine name of the Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$SERVERNAME$$ - Enter the domain and machine name of the Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: The server name must be followed by a “$” symbol, as shown in the example (for example, MyDomainMyServerName1$).
segment.target: The server name must be followed by a “$” symbol, as shown in the example (for example, MyDomainMyServerName1$).

segment.source: $DOMAIN$$REPORTSUSERNAME$ - Enter the user account name that was used to configure the data source for the Compliance and Audit Reports.
segment.target: $DOMAIN$$REPORTSUSERNAME$ - Enter the user account name that was used to configure the data source for the Compliance and Audit Reports.

segment.source: The command lines that are listed for adding server computer accounts to the MBAM local groups must be run for each Administration and Monitoring Server that will be accessing the databases in your environment.
segment.target: The command lines that are listed for adding server computer accounts to the MBAM local groups must be run for each Administration and Monitoring Server that will be accessing the databases in your environment.
